# Get Started Docs

## Getting Started with LINQ in C#

- [Introduction to LINQ queries](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/get-started/introduction-to-linq-queries.md): LINQ offers a consistent model for queries on data across various kinds of data sources and formats. In a LINQ query, you're always working with objects.
- [Query expression basics](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/get-started/query-expression-basics.md): Introduces concepts related to query expressions
- [Write LINQ queries](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/get-started/write-linq-queries.md): Learn how to write LINQ queries in C#.
- [Type relationships in LINQ query operations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/get-started/type-relationships-in-linq-query-operations.md): Learn how types of variables in a LINQ query relate to each other. LINQ query operations are strongly typed in the data source, in the query, and in execution.
- [C# features that support LINQ](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/get-started/features-that-support-linq.md): Learn about C# features to use with LINQ queries and in other contexts.
- [Tutorial: Writing queries in C#](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/get-started/walkthrough-writing-queries-linq.md): This walkthrough shows how C# language features are used in LINQ query expressions.
